title-group.article-title: UNIFORM ùëô¬π CONVERGENCE IN THE CRANK-NICOLSON METHOD OF A LINEAR INTEGRO-DIFFERENTIAL EQUATION FOR VISCOELASTIC RODS AND PLATES

abstract.p: We study the numerical approximation of a certain Volterra integro-differential equation in Hilbert space which arises in the linear theory of isotropic viscoelastic rods and plates. The equation is discretized in time using a method based on the trapezoidal rule: while the time derivative is approximated by the trapezoidal rule in a two-step method, a convolution quadrature rule, constructed again from the trapezoidal rule, is used to approximate the integral term. The resulting scheme is shown to be convergence in the ${\mathrm{l}}_{\mathrm{t}}^{1}(0,\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{\infty };\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{H})\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\cap \text{\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{l}}_{\mathrm{t}}^{\mathrm{\infty }}(0,\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{\infty };\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{H})$ norm.
